lyrics.translation: 第59课 进来还是出去

lyrics.text: First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: Our dog Rex used to sit outside our front gate and bark.
lyrics.translation: 我们的狗雷克斯过去常常坐在我们前门外面叫。

lyrics.text: Every time he wanted to come into the garden, he would bark until someone opened the gate.
lyrics.translation: 每次他想进入花园时，他都会叫个不停，直到有人打开大门。

lyrics.text: As the neighbors complained of the noise, my husband spent weeks training him to press his paw on the latch to let himself in.
lyrics.translation: 由于邻居们抱怨噪音，我的丈夫花了好几个星期训练他用爪子按下门闩，让自己进来。

lyrics.text: Rex soon became an expert at opening the gate.
lyrics.translation: 雷克斯很快就成了打开大门的专家。

lyrics.text: However, when I was going out shopping last week, I noticed him in the garden near the gate.
lyrics.translation: 然而，上周我出去购物的时候，我注意到他在大门附近的花园里。

lyrics.text: This time he was barking so that someone would let him out.
lyrics.translation: 这次他叫是为了让人放他出去。

lyrics.text: Since then, he has developed another bad habit.
lyrics.translation: 从那时起，他又养成了一个坏习惯。

lyrics.text: As soon as he opens the gate from outside, he comes into the garden and waits until the gate shuts.
lyrics.translation: 他一从外面打开门，就走进花园，一直等到门关上。

lyrics.text: Then he sits and barks until someone lets him out.
lyrics.translation: 然后它坐下来叫，直到有人放它出去。

lyrics.text: After this, he immediately lets himself in and begins barking again.
lyrics.translation: 在这之后，他立刻让自己进来，然后又开始吠叫。

lyrics.text: Yesterday, my husband removed the gate and Rex got so annoyed that he has not seen him since.
lyrics.translation: 昨天，我丈夫把门拆掉了，雷克斯非常生气，从那以后他就再也没有见过他。
